meanings.definition: Permeant: capable of being permeated or penetrated
meanings.sent1: The sponge was so permeant that it absorbed all the water quickly.
meanings.sent2: The fabric was permeant, allowing the dye to spread evenly.
meanings.sent3: The permeant sponge was like a thirsty desert traveler, soaking up every drop.
meanings.sent4: Her permeant curiosity led her to explore every nook and cranny of the old house.
meanings.sent5: The permeant fog enveloped the city, shrouding everything in a misty veil.

meanings.definition: Permeant: allowing liquids or gases to pass through easily
meanings.sent1: The permeant membrane in the filter allowed clean water to flow through.
meanings.sent2: The permeant soil let the roots of the plants breathe and grow freely.
meanings.sent3: The permeant balloon deflated quickly when a tiny hole appeared.
meanings.sent4: His permeant arguments penetrated even the toughest defenses of his opponents.
meanings.sent5: The permeant wind carried the scent of flowers from the garden into the house.
